name: Government, Law and Politics in Russia (formerly POL 437H1)
description: Law in the governance of Russia, in the Soviet and post Soviet periods, including constitutional development, courts, business disputes, crime and criminal justice, corruption, cultural obstacles to legal order, and legal transition in comparative perspective. (Given by the Department of Political Science and the Centre for European, Russian, and Eurasian Studies)
prerequisites: HIS351Y1/POL354H1/POL354Y1/a course in Russia or Soviet politics
